name: Castello di San Marco Charming Hotel & SPA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I meant to put up a review in July and I forgot so thought I would add it now. My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the hotel in July and we liked it very much. As everyone says it is a lovely old buildings and the pool is absolutely fantastic, the gardens are lovely and there are different places to sit around the grounds The staff are very nice and friendly and helpful and as a family run place they are all there to please. We had a junior suite and the room was great lots of room and a large bathroom, good shower. The hotel is a major wedding venue but having said that it never interfered with our holiday it was lovely seeing the weddings set up around the pool in the evening and the rooms are a little way away so we never heard any noise either. The place is quite quirky and the summer dining room is in a sort of tended courtyard. The breakfast was good and dinner was nice but as we went a la cart we did find the menu did have not have enough variety. I understand that if we had gone half board we may have seen a change / special. We appreciate the menu is restricted to ensure that the food is good quality and fresh but a daily special would have been a bonus. Having read a couple of the more recent reviews I can assure you there are other restaurants nea by and you do not need to go into Taromina . There are 2 areas in Giardini Naxox one strip along the beach area but a nicer quieter strip sort of hidden behind the main bus stop ( ask for the Hilton hotel) . I think people just did not find them – and that is possibly one of my few criticisms of the hotel, as they are keen to encourage you to use their dining room they do not help by pointing out where else to go. There is a fantastic restaurant ( great value for money ) in a castle on top of the hill in the nearest village, and a great sea food place in Giardini also some good pizza places so you could mix and match high dining at the hotel with a slightly less expensive dinner another night. Taromina is lovely but to have to trip in there in the evening does seem like a bit too much trouble.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel and wonderful pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds of the hotel were immaculate and so was the beach. The facilities were great but beware as with most of Italy you pay for them even as a guest and at our exchange rate this was working out at £11 per day for 2, but that was cheaper than others I saw and much less crowded. It is not completely private to the hotel as other people can pay to use it but it seemed to me that hotel guests tended to get the better positioned sun beds nearest to the sea.
reviews.title: A piece of heaven on earth - we loved it!!

reviews.text: The new Spa was great and not being a spa person it was nice to treat myself on holidy - Alison ( if i remember correctly ) was very nice and the products were very nice.
reviews.title: Lovely old hotel in lush gardens with very large pool and space to chill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only other comment is that the room had a lovely terrace with a table and chairs and we spent a lot of time there early evening, and my husband who is light skinned retired there at lunch time so we would have appreciated a couple of lounging chairs as well there is plenty of room for them and in fact the terrace is so large it would add to the look. We did ask for a deck chari as we saw one on a balcony and these were promised but I suspect it was a busy day and they forgot we did not follow it up.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect - siete miti !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a very hectic few months we wanted a holiday somewhere where we could relax, chill and recharge our batteries. We walked through the impressive wrought iron gates of this lovely old castello and wow! - did the family owned and operated Castello Di San Marco deliver!!
reviews.title: an idyllic retreat on the Sicilian coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from spending a week at Castello di San Marco. This really is a lovely place to stay. The grounds are very well kept and it's just a lovely place to walk around. The garden is well maintained with water features, lots of fruit trees and rabbits! The pool area is spotlessly clean and surrounded by trees. There is a private beach area - however, although this part of the beach is for use by hotel guests there is a charge of 18 Euros each person for the day for use of the beds and parasol - so be aware as this could easily add up a charge to your bill. The jacuzzi was broken when we were there so I cannot comment on it rather than say it would have been nice to use. There are a few points that let this hotel down, and that's the reason it doesn't get 5 stars. First of all there are carpets in our rooms. These carpets are dirty. They are full off visable bits of dirt. These carpets were never vacuumed for our entire stay. They were do grubby that we put them under our bed rather than walking on them. Next is the maid that cleans the room. Sometimes we would have your plastic cups replaced, sometimes we didn't. Very often the empty plastic cup that was used the day before and accidently left at the side of the bed was never emptied or thrown away by the maid. The bed linen although clean isn't the best quality (sorry - but I expect better linen for £1700 for a weeks package holiday!) and were scratchy. The pillows are hard and uncomfortable. The towels are also a bit thin and greying. There are also a few mosquitos in the rooms. Plug-ins with repelant are provided but they're not very effective, so bring your own and make sure you have plenty of repelant on your body when walking around the grounds at night as you will get eaten alive! We ate once in the hotel. The food was lovely, but the experience wasn't. We were never asked if we wanted sweet or coffee. Perhaps it's because there was a rich couple in the restaurant at the same time as us demanding all the attention? Who knows, but we were let down by the service at dinner and felt ignored. We had our breakfast outside every day in a marquee and it was lovely. A good choice of food but only hot bacon and scrambled egg, nothing else, so if you like a hot breakfast (ie, the full monty) you're not going to get one! And although the food is good, it is somewhat over-priced, we paid 19 Euro's for a first course of pasta! Another thing worth noting is the weddings. There are weddings every night and they make a lot of noise! There are shutters on your windows so use them! We also couldn't use the pool area to sit one evening as there was a wedding next to the pool! It's also worth noting that this hotel is remote. There is virtually nothing within walking distance other than the beach. The nearest town that is safe to walk around is Gardini naxos and you will need a car to get there. Taormina is further still but you can get there in 20 mins using the autostrada. This is a lovely place to stay, but just be prepared for it being remote so not ideal if you don't have transport. And hopefully they will have cleaned the rugs by the time you get there!
reviews.title: A Castello that could do a little better.

reviews.text: We have just had the most fabulous holiday in Sicily staying with friends for 4 nights in their Villa near Siracusa and then we descended on the Castello .
reviews.title: Fabulous and first class hotel.

reviews.text: We were booked four days end of the high season and had paid the going rate which is probably a bit more than most hotels in the region but worth every penny .
reviews.title: The 'Fawlty Towers' of Sicily....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were met by Simone a very nice smiley man who took us and helped with our bags to our very nice room a small distance from the hotel which was kind ,Simone also speaks good English and is extremely helpful.
reviews.title: Charming castle retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms surround the Castello ,some are in the beautiful very well kept gardens and some are attached to the Castello ,we were slightly further away in room 136 which is in a row of attached villas surrounded by lovely flowers gardens and trees.The paths around the beautiful Castello are all well lit so late at night it is a 2 minute walk from the Castello ,you will notice how spotlessly clean and well presented the paths ,gardens and all the amenities are. The room we had was perfect ,had all the amenities of a first class hotel other than wifi which is being installed soon we believe ,there is wifi in the reception and bar areas and also by the pool.The soaps and creams in the room are all high end Etro ,the bed was very comfortable, our son enjoyed his pull out bed in the living room which is a perfectly good size.Out of the back windows of the roomyou look across a large field and up into the hills beyond ,my only gripe re the room is that maybe we should of had complimentary water put in the room at the end of each day ,we actually bought it by the pool and squeezed it into the minibar to keep cold ,or just call room service and they will deliver with a smile.The air conditioning in each room worked well .
reviews.title: Top notch hotel with beautiful grounds

reviews.text: Really nice food!From startes to main dish!fantastic style and atmosphere.Also the room was good looking.
reviews.title: Top sea food
Charming, friendly family hotel
reviews.text: This is a really charming hotel set in beautiful peaceful gardens close to Taormina but set away from the bustle of the town. It has a lovely swimming pool and is only a very short walk to the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hard to find any fault with this wonderful hotel. Beautiful grounds, pool, restaurant and excellent staff. It is a quiet oasis about a mile down the lane from the coastal road. Birdsong, both night and day in May, was often the only sound to disturb the peace.
reviews.title: A Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The upgraded accomodation was spacious and the outside terrace was ideal for chilling out in the early evening.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots to see including the magnificent Valley of the Temples (3.5 hr drive), Etna, gorges, hilltop villages but be warned that Sicilian drivers are the worst in Europe! The busy road through Naxos is hair raising as indicators are rarely used and rights of way mean nothing - ALWAYS expect the drivers around you to do the most ridiculous things. Unfortunately if you want to eat out Naxos has the best selection of local restaurants so you have to use this road.
reviews.title: A romantic paradise

reviews.text: My fiancé and I booked in here for a relaxing break in September 2011.
reviews.title: Really?! Who's writing these reviews?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were allocated a romantic room which was relatively expensive but reckoned it must be worth it based on all the reviews on here. Trust me, it was not!!
reviews.title: Stylish Castle with excellent Facilities & Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very very dark and old fashioned with a dingy little bathroom with shower no bath. The bed was on a mezzanine level accessed via a set of steps so steep they could have doubled as a ladder. Honestly, we had to go downstairs backwards and I had horrible visions of tumbling down the stairs en route to the loo in the middle of the night. The mezzanine also was very hot as the air con struggled to circulate air that high up. As a result, my fiancé and I slept on the sofa downstairs the whole holiday as it folded out into 2 single bunks!! Talk about romantic!
reviews.title: Magnificent, we felt so pamperd after our relaxing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we asked about changing to a different room we were told that a standard room without a mezzanine would be several hundred euros more - for the exact same standard and crappy bathroom only over 1 floor instead of two!
reviews.title: Great, but unfortunately short stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room aside (though surely that's the main thing?) the hotel was quite nice if a bit shabby - it's largely the ruin of an old castle and has that musty museum look/smell to it! The grounds were very nice and the pool area was clean.
reviews.title: Disappointed but a good holiday nevertheless

aka: Castello Di San Marco Charming Hotel And Spa
description: Welcome to Castello di San Marco charming hotel & SPA, a boutique romantic hotel immersed in a luxuriant park, on the glittering Jonian sea, between Taormina and the volcano Etna, this noble castle represented a splendid example of Sicilian Baroque architecture and well describe a part of the Sicilian History. The unique beauty of Castello di San Marco is timeless and is adapted to romantic and relaxing holidays, with its tranquil exteriors and elegant, softly lit interiors.30 elegant and charming suites take place in the park surrounding main building, SPA & beauty center , fine restaurant, wine lounge with a selection of 250 fine wines, very large swimming pool, private beach, tennis court, private parking, mediterranean park.
